result.execSummary:
The defendant Deavaion Weston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deavaion Weston

records.addlTxt:
Upon the arraignment, the parties informed the court that they have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Counts 1 & 2:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum previously received and efiled.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.  State informed the court that they have satisfied victim notification.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
As to Count 1:  Serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 2 with credit for 14 days time served.
As to Count 2:  Serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 1. 
As to both sentences, court grants Huber privileges for school, work and treatment.
Court stayed the sentences and placed defendant on 18 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- no violations of the law
- stay in school and obtain a diploma

There is no restitution request.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, cash bail to apply.  

Appeal rights given 
*
Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charges are misdemeanors, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence and if defendant has no new law violations.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Deavaion Weston in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Deavaion Weston.  Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
